descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this class, students will learn the basic skills and concepts needed for working in a recording studio, including microphone placement, mixing board operation, multi-track recording, setting up monitoring systems, running a session, and creating a final mix. Classes will be held in the new Louis 105 Sound Theater. Pre-requisites are RTVF 190 and RTVF 383, or instructor permissio

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Students will acquire a practical knowledge in the following areas:
? Audio Basics review
? Signal flow within the studio
? Microphone types, techniques, and placement strategies
? Mixing board operation, layout, and techniques
? Monitor mix setup and management
? Running a session with multiple musicians
? Tracking in Pro Tools
? Working with a tracked session to create a final mix

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will be graded on their successful completion of smaller recording projects, and on a final project where they record and mix a complete song with a band. A midterm and final exam will also be administered.
